item.title: Report X-2024091893
item.description:
Report X-2024091893

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared spill. One 1-gallon metal can of PPG 7-Line Alkyd paint leaked at the lid. Approx 1/2 pint spilled. All four cans in the shipment are dented, labels damaged. Lids shipped with plastic rings. Outer carton lightly crushed. No hazmat markings. Flashpoint 84.2 F.

item.title: Report X-2024091731
item.description:
Report X-2024091731

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-01T09:15:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office as on odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that one of the two metal cans inside was leaking from the lid. The cans had positive closure rings and packing paper for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024091833
item.description:
Report X-2024091833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared spill. Two 1-gallon metal cans of PPG 7-Line LV Alkyd paint leaked due to lids opening. Approx 1 gallon spilled. Labels damaged on remaining cans. Lids shipped with plastic rings, but no clips. Outer carton not significantly damaged other than from internal leakage. Flashpoint 84.2 F. No hazmat markings.

item.title: Report X-2024091794
item.description:
Report X-2024091794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=407039768880 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Pint PSN TEXT=Paint PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Quart MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Quart )Undeclared spill. Carton containing two 1-qt metal cans of KD3001 sealer, one 1-qt KBC03 basecoat, and two 8 oz metal cans of KDA3000 hardener. Cans shipped in larger box w/insufficient dunnage. All cans dented. Both KD3001 cans leaked, approximately .5 pint spilled. Crushed carton. No hazmat markings. KD3001 and KBC03 flashpoints below 100 F, KDA3000 flashpoint 100.4 F.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sept 19th a leaking package was found during the PM sort. The package contained four one gallon cans that are classified as UN1263, PAINT, 3, III. One of the cans positive closure failed allowing the contents to leak out. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024091476
item.description:
Report X-2024091476

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=778393819080 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1950 CLASS=21 QTY UOM=Gas - Milliliter PSN TEXT=Aerosols, flammable PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=500 CONTAINER UOM=Gas - Milliliter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=400 TOTAL UOM=Gas - Milliliter )Two fiberboard boxes of a nineteen pieces shipment showed signs of a release at the MEMH location. Each box contained one Hazmat pad for padding. One of the fiberboard boxes had four large clear Ziploc bags filled with fifty tiny bottles per bag. Four bottles in one bag leaked their contacts from the top caps of the bottles. The 2nd box contained twelve spray cans, eleven smaller spray cans, and one large clear Ziploc bag filled with fifty tiny bottles. Four bottles in one bag leaked their contacts from the top caps of the bottles. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. Inside of the fiberboard box were four plastic bottles and two of the bottles had spilled their contents. The two bottles both spilt at the seem under the handle. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024091442
item.description:
Report X-2024091442

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sept 14th a package was found during the PM sort that was leaking. The package was marked and labeled as UN1263, Petroleum Distillates N.O.S., 3, III. INside the package 2 of the cans leaked due to not being properly prepared for shipment. There were no ring locks or any secondary containment. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.
